bwwExcerpt: "If you usually see musicals from the back of the second balcony, the camera uncovers a whole new layer of meaning. You can see the worry lines on actors' faces. You can see the deep care they put into listening to their scene partners. You can see the private moments of joy and whimsy they steal. You can see that when SPCA worker Bonnie (Petrina Bromley) tries to comfort the animals stuck in cages on airplanes, she tries to channel her whole being to them through her eyes."
